intro: Diastatea serrata, commonly known as the serrated diastate, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, serrated leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. Diastatea serrata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
